channel.title: Cannot run some AppImage apps after Kicksecure upate
channel.description:
Some AppImage, not all, cannot run anymore after the latest point release 17.2.3.7 update. Here is an example with Bitwarden:
``` [user ~]% ./AppImage/Bitwarden-2024.9.0-x86_64.AppImage [9616:1002/015207.279258:FATAL:setuid_sandbox_host.cc(163)] The SUID sandbox helper binary was found, but is not configured correctly. Rather than run without sandboxing I'm aborting now. You need to make sure that /tmp/user/1000/.mount_BitwarIjvoLY/chrome-sandbox is owned by root and has mode 4755. Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped) zsh: exit 133 ./AppImage/Bitwarden-2024.9.0-x86_64.AppImage ```

item.title: Cannot run some AppImage apps after Kicksecure upate
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Try the same as mentioned in this very forum post: Can not run flatpak apps after Kicksecure update - #7 by Patrick

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot run some AppImage apps after Kicksecure upate
item.dc:creator: cookie.monster
item.description:
Some AppImage, not all, cannot run anymore after the latest point release 17.2.3.7 update. Here is an example with Bitwarden:

[user ~]% ./AppImage/Bitwarden-2024.9.0-x86_64.AppImage
[9616:1002/015207.279258:FATAL:setuid_sandbox_host.cc(163)] The SUID sandbox helper binary was found, but is not configured correctly. Rather than run without sandboxing I'm aborting now. You need to make sure that /tmp/user/1000/.mount_BitwarIjvoLY/chrome-sandbox is owned by root and has mode 4755.
Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)
zsh: exit 133   ./AppImage/Bitwarden-2024.9.0-x86_64.AppImage

Read full topic
item.source: Cannot run some AppImage apps after Kicksecure upate
